label.en: 24/25 S regular part 4 6 CP LT Eng
label.et: 24/25 K PÕ 4. osa 6 EAP LT Eng

description.en: This course is for the students interested in space technology and applications. During the course, a special project will be planned and carried out with the aim to obtain practical experiences in space instrumentation design, standards, quality management and procedures. The course activities are related to the Estonian Student Satellite Programme.
description.et: Kursus on mõeldud kosmoseuuringute temaatikast huvitatud üliõpilastele. Kursuse käigus viiakse meeskonnatööna läbi erinevaid kosmosetehnoloogiate või nende rakendustega seotud tegevusi; kursuse tegevus on seotud Eesti Tudengisatellidi projektiga. Kursus on avatud kõigi valdkondade üliõpilastele.

objectives.en: The aims of the course are:
- to raise the competence of Estonian industry and scientific institutes in the field of space technology by introducing this topic to the future workforce;
objectives.et: - tõsta eesti tööstuse ja teaduse võimekust kosmosetehnoloogia valdkonnas ettevõtetesse tööleasuvatele spetsialistidele antud valdkonna tutvustamise kaudu;

objectives.en: - to explain and popularize the field of space research, European Space Agency space programmes and the role of Estonian membership.
objectives.et: - kosmoseuuringute ning nende rakenduste, Euroopa Liidu kosmoseprogrammide ja Eesti osalusvõimaluste selgitamine ja populariseerimine.

learning_outcomes.en: After passing this course, the participants have experience in
learning_outcomes.et: Kursuse lõpuks on osalejad omandanud lisaks teoreetilistele teadmistele ka praktilise kogemuse

learning_outcomes.en: - PR activities related to a development project;

independent_work.et: Students will actively participate in the Estonian ongoing space developments: ESTCube-3, SUTS, KuupKulgur, ground segment, laboratories, and other activities. Students will be able to choose their desired specialty (electronics, software, simulations, mechanics, RF engineering, measurements, etc.) and tasks will be given by the team. For more information contact janis.dalbins@ut.ee.

description.et: Graded based on work accomplished in the space technology project

grade_preconditions.et:
The course lasts for two years and is divided into two syllabuses (one per semester) each of which gives 6 ECTS.  Students can choose to participate in only one syllabus. To be assessed, the student has to actively participate in one of the Estonian space projects.

We expect a one full day every two weeks or half-day every week presence in Tartu Observatory, in Tõravere (or documented remote work) depending on the specifics of the chosen task.

grade_evaluation.et: The work will be graded by the team leader. The student will be evaluated positively if the task will be fulfilled.

debt_elimination.et: In agreement with the lecturer before the start of the next semester

resources.mandatory_materials: These will be provided in the first lecture/meeting

description.et:
A short introduction to the course will give the participants an overview of the course requirements. 

The first seminar will be held in Zoom at 18:15 and the invite will be sent to all registrants to their UT e-mail.
